marklogic.body:
Translation; "We, the global elite', want to be able to tax you wherever you are. And also we want to be able to raise taxes whenever we feel like it, whether you peons' like it or not."
And if you believe he really thinks Americans are too heavily taxed, take a look at his Senate voting record on taxes. After which, I have some first-class beachfront property in the Everglades I'd like you to take a look at.
Joe the Mouth once again demonstrates that, in his never-ending quest to prove that he is The Smartest Guy In The Room, he can be counted on to run Off at the mouth. And in doing so, blurt out things the rest of the "enlightened ones" didn't want us peasants to know they are talking about amongst themselves.
Plugs may not be the best VOTUS ever, but he is certainly useful in the sense of the proverbial canary in the coal mine.
He's the gift that keeps on giving. Campaign Spots for the GOP, that is. Assuming that they're smart enough to actually use them.
clear ether
eon
